channel.title: I'm new to this
channel.description:
lol lets just say that i never edited the rs client before but i know the basics of java and I have no idea where to start.
is there a tutorial that shows basic client editing here becuz everything is sort of here and there and I've got no clue what's going on :(

item.title: I'm new to this
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Sap:

the rs2 deobfuscator by popcorn gives a giant exception list at the end but it still continues… and at the end it cant find “rsver.bat” and then it deletes everything extracted… If I exit the batch window b4 it deltes everything and then I start client.java and run it… exception! my noobness with client editing doesnt help me much tho…

make sure you download new version, extract to a clean folder, and maybe ask newbiehacker for his version getter which works unlike popcorns, or just make one in BCEL youself

Read full topic

item.title: I'm new to this
item.dc:creator: @popcorn89 popcorn89
item.description:
@popcorn89 wrote:

What does it say?

Read full topic

item.title: I'm new to this
item.dc:creator: @Sap Sap
item.description:
@Sap wrote:

YAY ITS OLLIE!!!

Btw, the two deobers on the forum. First one I think it was by Mopar the link is broken. The second one in another section, I ran it, it goes pretty well until at the end it just throws a bunch of exceptions then deletes everything that was extracted :? Srry for my noobness thx.

btw Ace showed me a pic of u, Ollie he said he could prolly take ya down

lolz…

edit:
the rs2 deobfuscator by popcorn gives a giant exception list at the end but it still continues… and at the end it cant find “rsver.bat” and then it deletes everything extracted… If I exit the batch window b4 it deltes everything and then I start client.java and run it… exception! my noobness with client editing doesnt help me much tho…

Read full topic

item.title: I'm new to this
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Sap, just look and print out things in the deob, best way to learn, once you have a basic knowledge of java you can do this really easy, start refactoring your code and then it should be easier to understand!.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm new to this
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

[quote=“popcorn89, post:3, topic:20317”][quote author=Exernet link=topic=30871.msg358626#msg358626 date=1162017038]
You need a lot of Java knowledge, just the basics won’t cut it… Oh if you plan to mess around with the client, be prepared cause you will get banned. As for tutorials, i’m pretty sure understanding the rs client is really vague to mostly everyone right now so there isn’t many tutorials. You might want to check out www.rs-resources.com, I believe Taios posted a few tips and tutorials there.
[/quote]
When I started client hacking I didn’t know any Java whatsoever, once you get the basics syntax down it’s really simple. There’s not many tutorials on client hacking, so you’ll pretty much just have to experiment. The easiest way would probably to use client 317 on private servers.[/quote]

I’d like to think I know the basics, then I open up some of the rs classes and they scare me away lol.

Anyways, good luck Sap

Read full topic

item.title: I'm new to this
item.dc:creator: @popcorn89 popcorn89
item.description:
@popcorn89 wrote:

Exernet:

You need a lot of Java knowledge, just the basics won’t cut it… Oh if you plan to mess around with the client, be prepared cause you will get banned. As for tutorials, i’m pretty sure understanding the rs client is really vague to mostly everyone right now so there isn’t many tutorials. You might want to check out www.rs-resources.com, I believe Taios posted a few tips and tutorials there.

When I started client hacking I didn’t know any Java whatsoever, once you get the basics syntax down it’s really simple. There’s not many tutorials on client hacking, so you’ll pretty much just have to experiment. The easiest way would probably to use client 317 on private servers.

Read full topic
